items.description:
It's still technically the weekend in other parts of the world, so hope you are enjoying it.

This edition has some interesting links for those of you looking at Maui. As always thanks to the wonderful Xamarin community for their content. Speaking of which, if you see some content you think should be in WeeklyXamarin, let us know by using our submission form - https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit

Have a great week!

‚ù§

Kym

items.title: Accessing device contacts
items.description:
Sometimes we have to integrate some functionalities into our Apps that require obtaining information from contacts, previously, to achieve this we had to take more development time, but now we have very good news!!! Xamarin Essentials included it for us!üíö We can implement this simply and easily! In this post, we will be learning how to do it! üòé

Gettings Contacts with Xamarin Essentials by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
Sometimes we have to integrate some functionalities into our Apps that require obtaining information from contacts, previously, to achieve this we had to take more development time, but now we have very good news!!! items.title: Extending Xamarin.Forms.Nuke for images that fail to load
items.description:
I wasn't aware of the Xamarin.Forms.Nuke library for better image handling on Xamarin.Forms iOS. This post discusses how to extend it to implement placeholder images when loading fails.

Extending Xamarin.Forms.Nuke on iOS to load a placeholder for images that fail to load | MSicc's Blog by Marco Siccardi
items.description_markdown:
I wasn't aware of the Xamarin.Forms.Nuke library for better image handling on Xamarin.Forms iOS. This post discusses how to extend it to implement placeholder images when loading fails.

[**Extending Xamarin.Forms.Nuke on iOS to load a placeholder for images that fail to load | MSicc's Blog**](https://msicc.net/extending-xamarin-forms-nuke-to-load-a-placeholder-for-images-that-fail-to-load/) by [Marco Siccardi](https://twitter.com/msicc)

embedded_links.title: **Extending Xamarin.Forms.Nuke on iOS to load a placeholder for images that fail to load | MSicc's Blog**

items.title: Pull-To-Refresh Everything with RefreshView in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Implement Pull-To-Refresh with any kind of layout with RefreshView that is available for you in Xamarin.Forms. In this video we will learn how to implement and customize this controls and how to refresh data in your application.

Pull-To-Refresh Everything with RefreshView in Xamarin.Forms by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Implement Pull-To-Refresh with any kind of layout with RefreshView that is available for you in Xamarin.Forms. In this video we will learn how to implement and customize this controls and how to refresh data in your application.

[**Pull-To-Refresh Everything with RefreshView in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wYoOhc24WMk) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

items.title: HTTP Web Requests with Data Caching | Xamarin 101
items.description:
The time has come to create and consume our ASP.NET Core Web API from our mobile application. In this Xamarin 101 video we take a look at calling CRUD operations from our Xamarin mobile app to our Web API backend. I step through what REST and HTTP is, how it works, how to call it, and how to cache data easily in your mobile apps.

HTTP Web Requests with Data Caching | Xamarin 101 by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
The time has come to create and consume our ASP.NET Core Web API from our mobile application. In this Xamarin 101 video we take a look at calling CRUD operations from our Xamarin mobile app to our Web API backend. I step through what REST and HTTP is, how it works, how to call it, and how to cache data easily in your mobile apps.

[**HTTP Web Requests with Data Caching | Xamarin 101**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a37qBMt0V9w) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

embedded_links.title: **HTTP Web Requests with Data Caching | Xamarin 101**

items.title: Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter
items.description:
In this episode we will learn everything about the DateTimeOffsetConverter that is included in the Xamarin Community Toolkit. Mark Allibone knows from first-hand experience that sometimes, in a backend, dates are stored as an offset. To not be bother with all kinds of time zone hassles, he wrote the DateTimeOffsetConverter. And now, Mark has contributed that converter to the Xamarin Community Toolkit so everyone can benefit!

Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter by The Xamarin Show
items.description_markdown:
In this episode we will learn everything about the DateTimeOffsetConverter that is included in the Xamarin Community Toolkit. Mark Allibone knows from first-hand experience that sometimes, in a backend, dates are stored as an offset. To not be bother with all kinds of time zone hassles, he wrote the DateTimeOffsetConverter. And now, Mark has contributed that converter to the Xamarin Community Toolkit so everyone can benefit!


[**Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/Xamarin-Community-Toolkit-Forget-Time-Zones-with-DateTimeOffsetConverter) by [The Xamarin Show](https://channel9.msdn.com/shows/xamarinshow)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin Community Toolkit - Forget Time Zones with DateTimeOffsetConverter**
